text: Jiang Bihou (; 22 November 1923 â€“ 16 December 2017), better known by his pen name Tu An (), is a Chinese poet and translator. He was a member of China Writers Association. Jiang was the first person from China to write sonnet in Chinese and he was the first few in China who translated the works of John Keats's into Chinese language. His translation, Poetry of John Keats, which had won the 2nd Lu Xun Literary Prize in 2000. Jiang died on 16 December 2017 in Aarhus, Denmark of complications from Parkinson's disease at the age of 94. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:21st-century Chinese poets Category:Chinese translators Category:20th-century Chinese poets
title: Tu An
